pr_title: Extend structures and structure pools mappings

timeline.message: Extend structures and structure pools mappings

timeline.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: There’re 2 toDynamic methods: one is protected and implemented in children, the other one is public, implemented in the parent and calls the protected one. As they have the identical signatures it is necessary to give them different names, so I used Raw to indicate that this is not a final dynamic, which the consumer will get
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: But what do they do differently? Does the public one just call the protected one, or does it also do something more?
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: The public one merges some additional info with the result of the protected one
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Hmm, so like contentToDynamic instead?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: I don’t see much difference
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Then should be rawToDynamic than toRawDynamic
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: True
replies.author: falseresync

timeline.bodyText: maybe map or transform, and arg3 and arg 4 are like sizeX and sizeZ
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: map/transform sound a bit too generic to my taste, maybe someone else also has a thought on that
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: "mirror and rotate" is way too wordy. A structure can have a position remapped by a mirror and a rotation combination, so map or remap is accurate.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: @Runemoro want to hear from you here.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: The operation of mirroring, rotating, and offsetting is called an isometry. But I don't know how to turn that into a method name... applyIsometry? isometricTransform? transform?
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: I might be wrong, but the actual code is about mirroring and rotating the given offset, and then applying it to the position, which is even trickier
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Then applyTransformedOffset. The specific transformations applied to the offset should just be in the parameter names.
replies.author: Runemoro

replies.bodyText: What’s about its derivative addMirroredAndRotatedSize, which uses structure size as offset; is it good as offsetByTransformedSize?
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Should rename that offset  to pivot
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: In this case it is an offset, not a center of the rotation
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Hmm, applyOffsetTransform?
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: It applies transformed offset, not offset(ted) transformation
replies.author: falseresync

replies.bodyText: Then I support runemoro's applyTransformedOffset
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Already committed that
replies.author: falseresync

timeline.author: liach

            		ARG 4 transformed
